stimulusHtml: For 0 ≤ t ≤ 20, the average temperature of the water in the tub is 1 20 ∫ 0 20 W ( t ) d t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CE@ . Use a left Riemann sum with the four subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate  1 20 ∫ 0 20 W ( t ) d t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CE@ . Does this approximation overestimate or underestimate the average temperature of the water over these 20 minutes? Explain your reasoning.

features.html: The temperature of water in a tub at time t is modeled by a strictly increasing, twice-differentiable function W, where W(t) is measured in degrees Fahrenheit and t is measured in minutes. At time t=0, the temperature of the water is 55oF. The water is heated for 30 minutes, beginning at time t=0. Values of W(t) at selected times t for the first 20 minutes are given in the table above.
